thread.title: Former Jefferson star Shirreffs has big day in losing effort for UConn
thread.title_full: Former Jefferson star Shirreffs has big day in losing effort for UConn

author: The Associated Press
title: Former Jefferson star Shirreffs has big day in losing effort for UConn
text:
The Associated Press Related Articles Georgia Southern powers past New Mexico State Blewitt's late field goal helps Pitt over Georgia Tech, 31-28 UNG men's soccer blanks Clayton State, 1-0 Piedmont women play out scoreless draw with Maryville 
EAST HARTFORD, CONNECTICUT â€” Quinton Flowers threw for 157 yards and two touchdowns and ran for 98 yards and another as South Florida beat UConn 28-20 on Saturday. 
Receiver Rodney Adams caught five balls for a career-high 118 yards and three touchdowns as the Bulls (3-3, 1-1 American) put together back-to-back wins for the first time since October 2013. 
Marlon Mack rushed for 113 yards, all but nine of those coming in the second half. His 59-yard run down the left sideline in the third quarter set up a 15-yard touchdown scramble by Flowers that gave the Bulls a 21-13 lead. 
UConn quarterback and former Jefferson High standout Bryant Shirreffs completed 28 of 41 passes for 365 yards and a touchdown for UConn (3-4, 1-2). He also ran for 100 yards, but was sacked five times. Shirreffs helped lead the Dragons to the Class AA 2012 state championship. 
Running back Arkeel Newsome added 221 all-purpose yards for the Huskies.
